meanings.definition: Of or relating to the north.
meanings.sent1: The septentrional wind brought a chill to the air.
meanings.sent2: The explorer traveled in a septentrional direction.
meanings.sent3: The septentrional birds seemed to prefer the cooler climate.
meanings.sent4: Her septentrional nature always guided her decisions.
meanings.sent5: The septentrional landscape was covered in snow and ice.

meanings.sent1: The septentrional breeze carried the scent of pine trees.
meanings.sent2: The ship sailed under the septentrional flag.
meanings.sent3: The septentrional visitors were amazed by the warm weather.
meanings.sent4: His septentrional accent gave away his origin.
meanings.sent5: The septentrional migration of birds was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Located in or toward the north.
meanings.sent1: The septentrional region was known for its long winters.
meanings.sent2: The septentrional countries experienced shorter days in winter.
meanings.sent3: The septentrional hotel offered stunning views of the mountains.
meanings.sent4: The septentrional side of the mountain was covered in shadow.
meanings.sent5: The septentrional lights danced across the sky in a mesmerizing display.
